titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-118vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-6rc) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 6rc-6vb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 6vb-12ra) I-4) Monday (fols. 12ra-25va) - Night hours (fols. 12ra-14rb) - Day hours (fols. 14rb-25va), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 16vb-17va); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree for Monday morning (fols. 17va-19vc); anonymous Homily for the ninth hour of Monday morning (fols. 23rb-24ra) (cp. AKM-006, fol. 26vb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 25va-36vc) - Night hours (fols. 25va-27rc) - Day hours (fols. 27rc-36vc) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 36vc-47vb) - Night hours (fols. 36vc-38rc) - Day hours (fols. 38rc-38vc, 41rv [?], 42ra-43vc, 40ra-40vc, 39va-39rc, 44ra-47vb), fols. misplaced I-7) Thursday (fols. 47vb-62rb) - Night hours (fols. 47vb-49rc) - Day hours (fols. 49rc-62rb) I-8) Friday (fols. 62rb-107va) - Night hours (fols. 62rb-71rb), including: Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 65va-68rb); - Day hours (fols. 72ra-107va), including: Homily by Jacob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 86rc-91vb) I-9) Saturday (fols. 107va-118vb) - Night hours (fols. 107va-110rb) - Mass (fols. 110rb-118vb), including: Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 117ra-118rc)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired; a half of the back board is missing. The Ms. was resewn. Several fols. are misplaced, some are loose. The upper edge of the text block is damaged; many fols. are affected by humidity, especially at the upper and bottom margins. Holes, e.g., on fols. 6, 7, 10, 26, 36, 39, 116. Holes repaired on fols. 7, 26, 73, 100. Fols. 1r-2v most probably coming from another Ms.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired, a half of the back is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards.

inks.ink: Black (in many fols. faded); red (brilliant vermillion).

squires.squire:
A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2 stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 4r-11v) – II(12; s.l.: 5, stub after 8; 8, stub after 5/fols. 12r-23v) – III(9; s.l.: 9/fols. 24r-32v) – IV(8/fols. 33r-40v) – V(12/fols. 41-53v) – VI(8/fols. 54r-61v) – VII(10/fols. 62r-71v) – VIII(10/fols. 72r-81v) – IX(10/fols. 82r-91v) – X(8/fols. 92r-98v) – XI(12/fols. 99r-110v) – XII(4/fols. 111r-114v) – XIII(5; s.l.: 1/fols. 115r-119v).
The structure of several quires, e.g. III-V, is unclear. Many folios are loose and have been crudely attached together through recent threads. In Quires IV and V some folios are misplaced.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Text I-1; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; directives for the ministers in Texts I-3, I-7 and I-8; the words ṣällǝyu in Text I-7 and nastäbäqwǝʿ in Text I-8; some interlineal corrections (e.g., fol. 78rc); elements of the punctuation signs, of Ethiopic numerals and of the text dividers.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ኢየሱስ for ኢየሱ (e.g., fols. 23rb, 46vb) ስ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ (in Text I-8, fol. 103va-c) ኃ፡ for ኃጣውኢነ፡ (in Text I-8, fols. 106va-107rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - In Quires IV and V (Text I-6), some folios are misplaced; in the "Short content" (s. above), the right order is given. - Fol. 39, loose leaf, is in reversed position. - The text on fol. 41rv has not been identified. - In many words, the 3rd order of a letter is written instead of the 5th; s., e.g., on fol. 53ra: እግዚአብሒር for እግዚአብሔር (ls.6-7) ኀቢየ for ኀቤየ (l.12) በጊዚሃ for በጊዜሃ (l.18) ይቢሎ for ይቤሎ (l.19); on fol. 57r, the words: ይቢሉ for ይቤሉ (fol. 57ra l.4) ላዕሊክሙ for ላዕሌክሙ (fol. 57rc l.16). - As nomina sacra, the name of Jesus is in this Ms. the name mostly rubricated. In the other Mss. with the same text, it is usually the name of Mary. - The indications of the day and night hours are Usually not rubricated.

additional.cont: Fols. 71rb-71vb: Prayer of the blessing for the Good Friday.

extras.extra: - Cues for the rubricator (words and numerals): fols. 75v, 76r, 76v, 77v, 78r, 82v, 85r, 101v, 113r. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: e.g., fols. 42rc, 67va, 68rc, 69va, 75va, 77va, 77rc, 78rc, 79rb, 79vc, 87bv, 107vc, 109vc. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 43rb, 107ra. - Corrections marked by thin lines above and below: e.g., fols. 78va, 86va, 86vb, 87ra, 95va. - On fol. 100vc, unclear sign (in black) over the indication (in red) of the 11th day hour of Friday. - Part of the text continues outside the layout, in the bottom margin and in a smaller script, on fols. 112r, 113r, 113rb, 114rb, 115ra, 114va, 115rb, 117rb, 118r. - Unfinished notes (recent hand?) on fol. 119v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The note ዘነግህ is written (between red and black horizontal lines) on the right margin of fol. 107r. - Notes in the margin referring to the content (?): fols. 106v, 112v, 113v, 114r, 115v, 117v.
